gov.usgs.anss.inventory

Class TreeRoot

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.inventory.TreeRoot

  • public class TreeRoot
extends java.lang.Object
    TreeRoot.java - This represents a dated TreeRoot - It is the top of the tree for hanging items and has its own table. Created on Apr 16, 2003, 1:23 PM NOTE: Remember, when you create one of these, if you want to be able to write it out you must register the treeModel and treeNode right after creation!

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FLAG_INVISIBLE
      FLAG_INVISIBLE masked into flags indicates this TreeRoot is "deleted"
      static int FLAG_SUPERCEDED
      FLAG_SUPERCEDED masked into flags indicates this TreeRoot has been superceded

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeRoot

        public TreeRoot(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
        This constructor assumes the result set was a query against the treeroots table. The information in the tree root tables is locationID, effective date, and flags The flags are currently limited as bit mask to 1=invisible, 2=superceded
        Parameters:
        rs - Result set positioned to create a TreeRoot
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - The Resultset must not have been positioned / broken

      • TreeRoot

        public TreeRoot(int inID,
                int locID,
                java.sql.Timestamp eff,
                int flags,
                java.lang.String netcode)
        This constructor creates a new treeRoot. This will not tie directly to a database record unless it is written() later. The primary data in the data base is locationID, effective date, and the flags.
        Parameters:
        inID - The "database ID" normally zero for this call
        locID - Location ID
        eff - A timestamp with the effective time/date of the root
        flags - The bit mask of flag
        netcode - The SEED network code (2 char)

    • Method Detail

      • writeTreeRoot

        public boolean writeTreeRoot()
        This routine updates the data base with the information in the tree root. If this treeroot is "new" (ID not found in DB), then it is created. If it exists, the old records in the tree table are deleted and the tree from this node is enumerated and used to create fully new records in the tree table.
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating success or failure to write out tree

      • populateTree2

        public boolean populateTree2()
        call this routine to populate a tree below the tree root. Often the treeRoots are displayed, but the entire tree beneath them are not obtained from the data base. This is done so we do not need to read all of the trees every time. This routine would be called when a particular tree root is selected, requiring the database to be read to populate the tree.
        Returns:
        boolean set to indicate success in reading the tree (SQLException found)

      • initialTree

        public void initialTree()
        This routine will run a query for all of the Items currently at a particular location ID. It then builds the found items into a tree structure following the connection rules and some smarts built in so the user does not to manually add non-tracking items etc to build up the tree. There are a couple of extraordinary things in this routine. This routine should be obsolete after initial tree build.

      • setTreeNode

        public void setTreeNode(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode t)
        after create we need to know the treeNode we are associated with, user needs to call us to make this information known!
        Parameters:
        t - The treed node this tree Root is associated with

        public void setInventoryChanged(boolean b)

        Parameters:
